topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Step 1b: Preparing the Network for Installation

body.p: Before installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, you are responsible for preparing the network for all installations.

section.title: VLAN ID Reference
section.p: Make sure you have all VLAN IDs defined for the networks as defined in the Architecture Diagram

section.title: Configure VLAN networking on the lifecycle manager host
section.p: Use the following steps to create the required network bridges.

ol.li: Launch a terminal and log in to your lifecycle manager host as root:sudo su -

Edit /etc/network/interfaces file to provide network details on the each interface: auto lo iface lo inet loopback
auto eth0 iface eth0 inet manual
auto eth0.1591 iface eth0.1591 inet manual post-up ifconfig $IFACE up pre-down ifconfig $IFACE down vlan-raw-device eth0
auto eth0.133 iface eth0.133 inet manual post-up ifconfig $IFACE up pre-down ifconfig $IFACE down vlan-raw-device eth0
auto eth0.1592 iface eth0.1592 inet manual post-up ifconfig $IFACE up pre-down ifconfig $IFACE down vlan-raw-device eth0
auto br-pxe iface br-pxe inet static address 10.200.186.43 netmask 255.255.255.0 gateway 10.200.186.1 bridge_ports eth0 bridge_stp off bridge_fd 9 bridge_hello 2 bridge_maxage 12 bridge_maxwait 0
auto br-clm iface br-clm inet static address 10.200.91.10 netmask 255.255.255.0 gateway 10.200.91.1 bridge_ports eth0.1591 bridge_stp off bridge_fd 9 bridge_hello 2 bridge_maxage 12 bridge_maxwait 0
auto br-bls iface br-bls inet static address 192.168.133.10 netmask 255.255.255.0 bridge_ports eth0.133 bridge_stp off bridge_fd 9 bridge_hello 2 bridge_maxage 12 bridge_maxwait 0
auto br-can iface br-can inet static address 10.200.92.10 netmask 255.255.255.0 gateway 10.200.92.1 bridge_ports eth0.1592 bridge_stp off bridge_fd 9 bridge_hello 2 bridge_maxage 12 bridge_maxwait 0
Launch a terminal and log in to your lifecycle manager host as root:sudo su -

Edit /etc/network/interfaces file to provide network details on the each interface (IP addresses masked for security): auto lo iface lo inet loopback
auto bond1 iface bond1 inet manual slaves eth0 eth1 bond_mode active-backup bond_miimon 100 bond_downdelay 200 bond_updelay 200 bond_lcap_rate faste bond_xmit_hash_policy layer2+3
auto bond1.1591 iface bond1.1591 inet manual post-up ifconfig $IFACE up pre-down ifconfig $IFACE down vlan-raw-device bond1
auto bond1.133 iface bond1.133 inet manual post-up ifconfig $IFACE up pre-down ifconfig $IFACE down vlan-raw-device bond1
auto bond1.1592 iface bond1.1592 inet manual post-up ifconfig $IFACE up pre-down ifconfig $IFACE down vlan-raw-device bond1
auto br-pxe iface br-pxe inet static address 10.200.x.x netmask 255.255.255.0 gateway 10.200.x.x bridge_ports bond1 bridge_stp off bridge_fd 9 bridge_hello 2 bridge_maxage 12 bridge_maxwait 0
auto br-clm iface br-clm inet static address 10.200.x.x netmask 255.255.255.0 gateway 10.200.x.x bridge_ports bond1.1591 bridge_stp off bridge_fd 9 bridge_hello 2 bridge_maxage 12 bridge_maxwait 0
auto br-bls iface br-bls inet static address 192.168.x.x netmask 255.255.255.0 bridge_ports bond1.133 bridge_stp off bridge_fd 9 bridge_hello 2 bridge_maxage 12 bridge_maxwait 0
auto br-can iface br-can inet static address 10.200.x.x netmask 255.255.255.0 gateway 10.200.x.x bridge_ports bond1.1592 bridge_stp off bridge_fd 9 bridge_hello 2 bridge_maxage 12 bridge_maxwait 0

section.title: Create network bridges
section.p: The installation process will create a virtual machine for the lifecycle manager.
Perform the following steps to enable networks that will be associated with lifecycle manager.

ol.li:
Launch a terminal and log in to your lifecycle manager host as root:
sudo su -

Create the br-pxe network by creating an XML definition file:
a. Manually create the XML file, using the name br-pxe.xml:cat br-pxe.xml <network> <name>br-pxe</name> <forward mode='bridge'/> <bridge name='br-pxe'/>
</network>
b. Execute the following commands to create and start the network and configure the network to auto-start:virsh net-define br-pxe.xml virsh net-start br-pxe virsh net-autostart br-pxe

Create the br-clm network by creating an XML definition file:
a. Manually create the XML file, here named br-clm.xml:cat br-clm.xml <network> <name>br-clm</name> <forward mode='bridge'/> <bridge name='br-clm'/>
</network>
b. Execute the following commands, using the name of your XML file, to create and start the network and configure the network to auto-start:virsh net-define br-clm.xml virsh net-start br-clm virsh net-autostart br-clm

Create the br-bls network by creating an XML definition file:
a. Manually create the XML file, using the name br-bls.xml:cat br-bls.xml <network> <name>br-bls</name> <forward mode='bridge'/> <bridge name='br-bls'/>
</network>
b. Execute the following commands to create and start the network and configure the network to auto-start:virsh net-define br-bls.xml virsh net-start br-bls virsh net-autostart br-bls

Use the virsh net-list command to view information on the new networks:virsh net-list
Name State Autostart Persistent ---------------------------------------------------------- br-bls active yes yes br-clm active yes yes br-can active yes yes br-pxe active yes yes default active yes yes

Execute the following command to make sure the br-pxe network has been assigned an IP address:ifconfig br-pxe
Run following command if the br-pxe does not indicate the IP address has been assigned:ifdown br-pxe ifdown <interface> ifup br-pxe ifup <yourinterface>
Execute the following command to make sure the br-pxe network was assigned the IP address of the primary interface.ifconfig | more
Execute the following command to make sure the primary interface does not have an IP address and confirm the IP address of the br-pxe network:ifconfig | more
Execute the following command to view the routing table. Make sure all of the networks are configured as expected.route -n

Execute the following command to make sure the VLAN ID is as expected. brctl show
The output should appear similar to the following:bridge name bridge id STP enabled interfaces br-bls 8000.5cb9017aa370 no eth0.210 vnet10 vnet14 vnet6 br-can 8000.5cb9017aa370 no eth0.208 vnet13 vnet5 vnet9 br-clm 8000.5cb9017aa370 no eth0.3007 vnet12 vnet2 vnet4 vnet8 br-dcm 8000.5cb9017aa370 no eth0.211 br-pxe 8000.5cb9017aa370 no eth0 vnet1 vnet11 vnet3 vnet7 virbr0 8000.febbccddeeff yes vnet0
